problem.p: Assuming the same conditions are still in place from part 2. Suppose the second machine fails 40 minutes into the hour, every hour for 10 minutes.
problem.label: Assuming the Kanban size is now 2, and the buffer is empty at time 0. How many parts are produced in the first hour?

div.p: Time 11-20: 1 part produced, Machine 1 is down, there is 1 part in Machine 2.
Time 21-30: 9 parts produced, system is starting up again with nothing in the system.
Time 31-40: 10 parts produced, both machines are up.
Time 41-50: 0 part produced, machine 2 is down, nothing leaves the system.
Time 51-60: 10 parts, machine 2 is back up, and immediately have a part to work on.

problem.label: If we increase the Kanban to 10, how many parts are produced in the second hour?

div.p: Time 1-10: 10 parts produced, machine two has part to work on at the start of the 2nd hour.
Time 11-20: 10 part produced, Machine 1 is down, there is 1 part in machine 2 and 9 parts in the buffer.
Time 21-30: 9 parts produced, system is starting up again with nothing in the system.
Time 31-40: 10 parts produced, both machines are up.
Time 41-50: 0 part produced, machine 2 is down, nothing leaves the system.
Time 51-60: 10 parts, machine 2 is back up, and immediately have a part to work on.
